message.content:
To create a regular expression (regex) that extracts a three character code like "1Jn" from a filename in the format "57-1Jn.usfm", you can use the following regex pattern:

```python
import re

pattern = r'(\d+-\w{3})\.usfm$'
filename = '57-1Jn.usfm'

match = re.search(pattern, filename)

if match:
    code = match.group(1)
    print("Extracted code:", code)
else:
    print("No match found")
```

This regex pattern works as follows:
- `\d+` matches one or more digits
- `-` matches the hyphen character
- `\w{3}` matches exactly three word characters (letters or digits)
- `\.usfm$` matches the ".usfm" extension at the end of the string
